summary.para: Creates an asynchronous bind context for use with asynchronous monikers.

param.name: reserved
param.para: This parameter is reserved and must be 0.

param.name: pBSCb
param.para: A pointer to the IBindStatusCallback interface used for receiving data availability and progress notification.

param.name: pEFetc
param.para: A pointer to the interface that can be used to enumerate formats for format negotiation during binding. This parameter can be NULL, in which case the caller is not interested in format negotiation during binding, and the default format of the object will be bound to.

param.name: ppBC
param.para: Address of an * pointer variable that receives the interface pointer to the new bind context.

returns.para: This function can return the following values.

description.para: The method ran out of memory and did not complete.
One or more parameters are invalid.

remarks.para: This function automatically registers the IBindStatusCallback and interfaces with the bind context. The client can specify flags from BSCO_OPTION to indicate which callback notifications the client is capable of receiving. If the client does not wish to receive certain notification, it can choose to implement those callback methods as empty function stubs (returning E_NOTIMPL), and they should not be called.
The RegisterBindStatusCallback function can also be used to register callback interfaces in the bind context.

summary.para: Creates an object that implements over a static array of structures.

param.name: cfmtetc
param.para: Number of structures in the static array specified by the rgfmtetc parameter. The cfmtetc parameter cannot be zero.

param.name: rgfmtetc
param.para: Pointer to a static array of structures.

param.name: ppenumfmtetc
param.para: Address of pointer variable that receives the interface pointer to the enumerator object.

returns.para: This function returns S_OK on success. Other possible return values include the following.

description.para: One or more parameters are invalid.

remarks.para: The CreateFormatEnumerator function creates an enumerator object that implements over a static array of structures. The cfmtetc parameter specifies the number of these structures. With the pointer, you can call the standard enumeration methods to enumerate the structures.
